verb.description: Begin to do or pursue (something) again after a pause or interruption.
examples: a day later normal service was resumed
hostilities had ceased and normal life had resumed

noun.description: A brief account of a persons education, qualifications, and previous experience, typically sent with a job application.

examples: I gave him a quick résumé of events

origin: Early 19th century: French, literally resumed, past participle (used as a noun) of résumer.
